comments:
Eclipse 3.1 M3

Today I noticed some hard to reproduce problems with Find/Replace (Ctrl+F on
Windows) in the Java Editor (code folding on). Basically I tried to search and
replace all occurencies of a string in a Java file.

(Ctrl+F -> enter text to find, enter replacement text, turned on wrap search and
case sensitive, scope all, direction forward -> click Replace All)

The workaround is to close the file, reopen it, perform the replace again, close
it again, reopen it again.

The following exception is logged:

Error 2004-11-10 12:45:49.187 java.lang.IllegalStateException

I also noticed that the history in the Find/Replace dialog is inconsitent and
that not all occurencies are replaced correctly.

Created an attachment (id=15775)
log file

I attached a log file that shows more exceptions and longer traces related to
the problem.

looks like a JFace text problem

Build I20041130. Reproducible case: Substitute a multiline string for a single 
line string resulting in an increase of the number of digits of the line 
number of the last line in the document.
verified in I200412162000 by code inspection and reverting fix to reproduce
